review_blob: If youre looking for an authentic German wheat beer flavor, this aint it. it totally lacks any traditional banana and clove flavors that German wheat beers are known for. Even the wheat flavor is understated. This is really more like an American style wheat beer with its neutral yeast flavor. Probably the worst German beer that I ever experienced.

IMO this is the perfect pumpkin ale. Not overwhelming in any area and perfectly balanced. Its beer that happens to be flavored, not the opposite. If you want a pumpkin pie, then, by all means, get one of the many over-the-top pumpkin ales out there.

big citrusy nose with hints of roast malt, pours deep amber with generous head and lacing, mostly citrus hop flavor with a slight roast malt backbone, nice body and mouthfeel, not a beer Id like a lot of, but pretty solid.

The oakeyness certainly comes through in a big way in the aroma and the flavor. Somewhat overwhelms the bourbon flavor which is secondary. Good creamy head and lacing in a very clear dark amber beer. Mildly hopped and carbed. I think they wanted this to taste more like bourbon than beer. Packs a wallop.

Beautyiful hazy amber color on pour with a full long-lasing head thru out the whole beer, good lacing, The beers generous conditioning releases the fruity raspberry aroma immediately. First taste is tart with a nice blend of fruit, brett and wheat all rolled into an evenly balanced brew. The hops balance the sweetness to a degree but do last until the finish. This beer is not overstated in any area and is a perfect summer beer, especially for those who like flavored beers.
beer_name: Lavery Oak Aged Raspberry Liopard Oir

review_blob: Pours a deep copper color with a full creamy off white head. aromas are caramel and a restrained smokiness, first taste is toffeelike with a subdued smokiness that blends well finally giving way to a fuller caramel and malt taste. This beer is a bit too sweet to balance the restrained hop profile and is the main drawback of this outstanding beer.

Bottle BB date 8/01/13 Pours clear and golden with a generous head and lacing, clove aroma is up front, taste is of plum and clove with some wheat character, hopping is very mild and is barely adequate to offset the malt sweetness, a bit of a lingering bitterness in the finish. Not your classic Abbey ale but a solid effort.

Wow, I dont understand the wide variations in ratings for this brew. Seems you either love it or hate it. I love it. Great taste of Amarillos with a nice subdued Belgian yeast flavor with enough malt backbone to support it. A finely crafted beer.

Pours a light gold in color with a decent head and lacing, faint aroma is metallic, mouthfeel is decent for style and is the best part about the beer, flavor is metallic and not much else, good looking in the glass so just leave it there.

I gave a bottle of this to a friend of mine who said it was one of the best beers that he had ever had. Of course, hes not much of a beer drinker. I found it good enough but lacked that intangible that makes a beer great. Perhaps some age will improve it.
Bottle 2010: pours brown with no head to speak of, aroma of caramel, flavor is caramel with a lot of sweetness, alcohol content evident, too much sweetness for balance, hard to finish this one.

Bottled Nov. 2008: Wow, pours deep red with an intense roasty, pruny nose, a lasting head and lacing to the end, the heaviest BW that I have ever had with a chewy palate, flavors of raisin & roast malts dominate, some sweetness balanced by an adequate hop bite at the finish. Noticeable alcohol burn and flavor, perhaps too much.
Pours yellow and very clear for a wheat beer, small head which fades quickly, wheat spicyness dominates with minimal yeast flavor, well balanced but nothing special.
Pours black as should be, not much head which doesnt last,  nice roasty aroma, very subtle coffee flavor is not overwhelming and is tasteful, could be better in most respects but is a decent beer.

This is my first black IPA and I must say Im impressed, both negatively and positively. Most everything seems to be done very well in the marriage of dark malts and citrus hops. Very hoppy aroma but a very malty flavor of dark malts. What I dont like is the odd combination of flavors in this beer. I prefer more traditional hops for this dark beer (more herbal or flowery). The hops overwhelm the palate about halfway through the glass so youre basically drinking an AIPA anyway.
beer_name: Stone Sublimely Self Righteous Black IPA

review_blob: Beautifully balanced between pumpkin, spice and malt flavor,nicely hopped to offset the moderate sweetness, not too much spice as the malt and pumpkin marriage is highlighted, a wonderful seasonal beer,

Nicely crafted pumpkin ale that is not too overwhelming in spiced flavor but more so than Sam Adams Pumpkin ale. Definate spiced flavor accentuates the maltiness and sweetness into a well crafted brew. However I prefer Sam Adams as it is not over the top at all.
On tap: light amber pour and fairly clear, nose of citrus and herbal, tastes the same, word is the herbs used in this brew are hyssop and lemon balm. A decent gruit.
Pours and looks like a great lager, aroma of hay and wet grain, taste is corny and of wet grains, more malty than hoppy which makes it go down very easy. Not a true pilsner in taste

Rather dark for an IPA, pours amber with a decent head, nose of noble herbal hops and some light roast malt, nice mouthfeel but lacks the hop bite of an IPA, bittered more like a pale ale but with IPA aroma and flavor hops. Very drinkable as a session beer.

Nice looking oatmeal stout, pours black with little head. Nice aroma of roasted malt and chocolate,  Luscious mouthfeel . A bit of  protein  lingers on the palate, probably from the oatmeal. Overall, very nice ale.
beer_name: Anderson Valley Barney Flats Oatmeal Stout

review_blob: I dont understand all the ratings calling this beer horrible. Compared to Bud light, this is a major step forward. It IS a light beer and should be rated as such. Ive had this beer on draft and in bottle and prefer the draft. It poured slightly darker than Bud Light with a decent off-white head. Flavor was mostly orange and coriander with some wheat in the background. Not overly carbonated makes this an easy beer to drink.  At  $23.00 a case, A-B will sell a lot of this.

Pours black with a robust tan head and great lacing, aroma of roasted malts, flavor is a balance of black and roasted malts with a sweetness in the finish balanced nicely with some hop bitterness. Overall, a solid example of a sweet stout.
Pours black with a decent head and lacing, nose is of molasses and roast malt, flavor is roasty with a good mouthfeel but very little carbonation, not a bad effort

Pretty much fits the commercial deScription except it didnt mention the quickly diminishing head and poor lacing., very tasty brew, definitely meant to be a session beer as it goes down very easy with no one thing to the forefront,, nice malt and hop marriage.

Very drinkable beer, light amber in color with a slight rose tint, nose of hibiscus, flavor is predominantly hibiscus with a sweet malt backbone, light body and carbonation, the slight acidity in this beer balances nicely the sweetness, Im sure there are no hops needed in this beer.
The deScription says it all, and is accurate. very flavorful beer not too sweet and well balanced, nice chocolate and coffee notes make this a great beer with food.

Very nice, I was impressed by this beer. It actually had flavor and good body. Nicely balanced between hop bitterness and malt sweetness and flavor, This would be a good beer to introduce lite beer drinkers to a craft beer, not too obtrusive in any area. Better than trying to force a Guiness down the throats of the uninicated.

Hah, this is no IPA. Very thin body doesnt even match a pale ale, It is hop dominant and out of balance with little malt to back it up, clean hop flavor is a redeeming quality but you can do much better. The rye isnt all that dominant either.
Not their best style, pours clear and slightly amber, minimal head, nice hoppy brew since it has almost no malt backbone, clean hop flavor is dominant, might be ok if you can get it on the cheap.

Not bad for AB/InBev, I was surprised by the yeasty wheat flavor of this brew, nice banana/clove presence, a bit thin on the wheat flavor and mouthfeel but would surely be a great summer refresher, Bravo! A major step in the right direction.

Pours a bright amber color with a passable head, good lacing, faint aroma of malt and hops, flavor is of some roasted malt and mild hops, nothing bock-like in this beer, more like an amber lager style but rather lite. Typical AB fare, catering to the masses.
Not as dark and heavy as some ISs but good nonetheless. Mild roast flavor and hopping makes it easy to drink. Would be a good introductory I.S. for the untrained palate.
UPDATED: JUL 14, 2009

aroma is intense cherry so I was hoping for something like Lindemans. No such luck. Although the flavor was good and flavorful, it had a strange tart edge to it that I found oddly out of place and not at all like a Lambic. The sweetness tasted artificial.
beer_name: Samuel Smiths Organic Cherry Fruit Beer

review_blob: On tap at brewery: Nice looking amber beer, very mild and malty, good session beer
beer_name: Sprague Farm Rust Belt Amber Ale

review_blob: On tap at brewery: The man at the tap told me that this was still a young beer so this batch may be different from the one others rated. Poured a golden amber with adequate head, a rather barnyard hop aroma was distinctly not a DIPA characteristic I was used to, flavor was the same, no citrus or flowery profile discernable, some malt flavor saved this beer from being bad.
Very drinkable dark beer, not hoppy with a full malt profile that doesnt just taste like caramel,

They call this a Heller Bock? Doesnt Helles mean light? This is more in line with a doppelbock except that it doesnt taste like one either. Tastes of caramel dominate the flavor profile, more like a porter, certainly not like any bock Ive had.
On tap at brewery: American style wheat beer which means that it has more malt profile than yeast, some nice caramel flavor along with wheat character, not real exciting however.
Looks like a witbeer should in all respects, yeasty aroma, not much spice or pepper in the flavor, some nice wheat character, a bit too hoppy for my tastes for a beer this light. definate hop finish

Looks good in the glass with the full creamy off white head contrasting with the black beer, aroma is of dark roast malt, flavor is definate black malt and nothing else, very one dimentional beer that only dry stout lovers would appreciate.

Looks good in the glass, aroma is yeasty and banana esters, taste is definate yeast banana flavor with little else, Tastes like it was brewed with a straight wheat beer yeast, nothing Belgian about the yeast, rather one dimentional

This is supposed to be the recipe used by 4 Sons when I rated it years ago, however I found this beer to be much more drinkable if not tame. Nice roasted grain flavor is subdued with a good hop balance, not the overpowering hop presence that I remember from the former. I nice drinking porter, er...stout....er...porter...er..distorter!

Sampler paddle: Another bright beer with decent carb., full malt flavor at first sip with a developing hop bite to balance, this is as good as most Helles beers Ive had and a solid effort, I hope this stays a regular on tap.
Sampler paddle: Light and bright beer, definately light in body and malt flavor, mildly hopped to compensate, Lawnmower beer to be sure but still better than the macros

Pours rather dark amber for a pale ale with adequate head, taste is a nice combo of malt and citrus, Ive had better APAs with more citrus/grapefruit flavor and aroma, The use of Willamette hops for dry hopping is a bad choice IMO.

Pours deep amber with an adequate head and lacing, strong aromas of various malts and some licorice, good flavor, and body to this beer as a barleywine should be, a bit sweet at this point in its young life, alcohol bomb at 10.2%
beer_name: Flying Dog Horn Dog Barley Wine

review_blob: Smells of apricots alright. Tastes of apricots too, Other than that, its a run of the mill Amer. wheat beer. Not much wheat or yeast character.

bottle dated 2008 pours coppery with a nice malt and golding aroma, good initial head and good lacing, smooth beer without a hot flavor considering its young age, nice balance of hops and malt, a rather sweet barleywine but would probably dry out with age, 10% alcohol is well hidden
beer_name: Heavy Seas Mutiny Fleet Below Decks
